item.title: STARBUCKS CORP Files SEC form 8-K, Other Events
4:55 pm Starbucks announces recommendation that shareholders 'reject' the mini-tender offer by TRC Capital
Starbucks Recommends Shareholders Reject “Mini-Tender” Offer by TRC Capital Corporation
item.description: [Business Wire] - Starbucks Corporation today announced that it received notice of an unsolicited “mini-tender” offer by TRC Capital Corporation to purchase up to 2 million shares of Starbucks common stock at a price of $54.38 per share in cash.

item.title: Starbucks Customers Get Exclusive Preview of Corinne Bailey Rae Album, The Heart Speaks In Whispers
item.description: [Business Wire] - Starbucks Coffee Company today announced its first-ever, exclusive preview of a studio album in Starbucks® stores, which will be played overhead more than a week ahead of its official release.

item.title: Cramer: The company hurt by McDonald's all-day breakfast
Starbucks sued for 'too much ice'
item.description: [AAP] - A customer has filed a $US5 million ($A6.5 million) lawsuit against Starbucks in the US, saying the chain puts "too much ice" in its cold drinks and consequently does not serve the volume of coffee or other liquid advertised. According to CNN, which had access to the terms of the suit filed in Chicago, the document charges that Starbucks advertises the amount of coffee or other liquids their cold drinks contain, but that volume is only attained if the ice content is included. "Starbucks has engaged in the practice of misrepresenting the amount of Cold Drink a customer will receive.
